intro: Boopis itatiaiae, commonly known as the Itatiaia sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, a common feature among sedges. Boopis itatiaiae plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
